page.title: 15Subsidence.
page.content: Two years ago miners at Sarlston pit were working underneath the village. Lots of buildings suffered from subsidence. One house had to be held up with a wooden frame. Our school was badly damaged. Walls cracked, the floors in the library and staffroom lifted, doors and windows would not shut and the roof began to leak. Workmen came in to mend the damage and were here for over a year. All the classes kept having to move rooms whilst all the plaster was replaced. The infants corridor was closed off and a new wall and floor was put in. After the builders had finished the school was repainted cream white and brown. Now workmen are in again putting in new pipes and radiators and a new boiler. Men are also working on the roof.
